result.execSummary:
The defendant Kimberly Ann Johnson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Maintain Drug Trafficking Place, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.42(1).
  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

09:02 AM Defendant Kimberly Ann Johnson in court, in custody.  Attorney David L. Christian in court for Kimberly Ann Johnson.  Attorney Rick C Spoentgen in court for State of Wisconsin.  Court states case and State states appearances.  State makes record re: the full name of the victim as to the restitution amount.  Court so orders.  State states the joint recommendations.  Atty Christian and DE are in agreement.  Court questions DE on plea agreement.  DE pleads NC.  Court questions DE on pleas/accepts/finds DE guilty.  Court advises DE re: voting rights and felony firearms warnings.  State makes statement on behalf of the joint recommendation.  Atty Christian makes statement on behalf of DE.  DE makes statement on her own behalf.  Court sentences.

2:27 PM Prosecuting attorney Rick C Spoentgen in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Kimberly Ann Johnson appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Janae F. Hochmuth appeared by video for Kimberly Ann Johnson.  Defendant received and waives reading of complaint.  Court advises DE of charges/max penalties.  Court notes Atty Christian has been appointed to this case.  Atty Hochmuth agrees.  Time limits waived for preliminary hearing.  State requests $2,500 cash bond.  Atty Hochmuth requests a signature bond or no more than $100 cash bond.  $250.00 CASH bond set.  Special bond conditions as follows: Absolute sobriety from and no possession of a controlled substance without a valid Rx.
